instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.PPBUSS_G3H: What is PPBUSS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PPBUSS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
customer said..
it was working on battery then one day it wasnt.


i have replaced the battery with no fix.
funny thing is the macbook attempts to turn on after new battery is installed, but it comes up with charge me flashing on screen.
i plug in charger, it turns on..
battery has an x in it and in system reports it says no battery installed.

i have chacked
J6951, seems fine
<TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR>, seems fine.
the only questionable thing i seen around J6951 was <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR>, it reads 2769 in diode mode.
this reading was done with the daughter board disconnected.
could this be the problem?
thanks in advance for any advice

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> must be checked in ohm, 10K.
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> must be 0V, to enable the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
thanks, I've tested it and it tests fine.
I've checked it with daughter board and battery connected. 
I get it flactuating between. 02-.01v
I've also tested it was only daughter board, I get 0 with daughter board.
But when I screw the battery connector screw in it flactuates between .02-.01v
i check pin seven on the flex cable from daughter board, it reads 0.?
<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> is on a ground pad.
Where would this .02v be coming from?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
work mentioning, with only the battery connecting the battery to the board.
I only get. 50v on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>
with the daughter board I get over 11v

i don't have a known good to use as a test point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
You must have the battery connected with the data flex and tightened screw.
0.01-0.02V is insignificant fluctuation; <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is good.
11V means the battery is enabled.
Is the same voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery alone?
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> then?

Post voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Should be good to test known good flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
OK.
so <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> is reading 11.44v
<SIGNAL>PPBUSS_G3H</SIGNAL> is also reading 11.44v
with battery alone <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> only reads 1.5v and on <SIGNAL>PPBUSS_G3H</SIGNAL> it reads 1.30v.. 
thats without battery data flex connected. 
I've just noticed something strange. 
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> is climbing slowly up and so is <SIGNAL>PPBUSS_G3H</SIGNAL>. on about 1 minute they both clime around .20v bot there is a 20mv diffidence.
that's when battery data is not connected.
with battery alone I don't get any volts on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>, with data flex connected I get 11.44 same as reads on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>. 

scl and sda lines on pin 2 and 3 of j6951 both read 3.40 but they both seem to flactuates between 3.30-3.40v

diode mode
j6951 pin 2 scl .449mv
j6951 pin 3 sda .449mv
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> .649mv
<SIGNAL>PPBUSS_G3H</SIGNAL> .448mv

not sure if I mentioned this. 
when I open the screen on battery the fan starts and backlight comes on. then it flashes the flat battery symbol.. 
as stated above in description, it runs on power but does not see battery.
Thanks again for your time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message: am ordered new bat data flex now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
I don't need any mention about battery voltage WITHOUT data flex; battery is not enabled without it.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> on battery alone?
I mean when you get 11.44V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, from battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message: yes I get 11.44 on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> on battery alone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
"I get 11.44 on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>"
I don't believe you, really.
Half board should be fried...

Please, post accurate information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message: oops, sorry man. I mean 3.30v sorry.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
You may have problems with SMC.
May need to reball it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
what makes you say that?
why can't i just reflow it? 
Sorry for giving wrong voltages on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. it was late the night before and I sent the massage in the morning without thinking. 
it was the correct voltage on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.

if it helps... 
When battery connected and I open the lid, it turns it on. but just goes to screen saying flat battery. 

reballing smc is deficuilt, and from my understanding a last step.? 

what is the name of the battery connected screw flex thing? 
I'd like to order one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message: it works fine on power, just not battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
You said battery is not recognized at all.
When SCL/SDA readings look good, usualy bad SMC.
So even reball may not help.

A simple reflow will not always resolder all the balls correctly...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
OK, so update...
I got anew flex for battery data, I noticed the battery screw metal flex had a bad crease. 
I took it off and soldered the positive and negetive to the main board. 
the system sees the battery now. 

where can I buy a new battery screw metal flex from, what is it called?
eBay only showing data flex for battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
hello again.
Waiting on your response. 
If you could please point me in the right direction to get the screw flex for main battery to mboard replaced. 
I've checked ebay and a few other places. 

or is it OK to just solder a high amp/volt wire to the positive and leave it like that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 not working with battery
threads.message:
Probably soldering direct wires is the only option.
Never faced with such problem.
However, even the power lines of battery are directly soldered on the MLB, no voltage comes there until data flex is connected.
